item.description:
Welcome! I am a PhD candidate in Political Science at the University of Pittsburgh. My research interests are broadly in international political economy and political behavior.

My dissertation analyzes how public support for free trade evolves over time and the conditions under which policymakers adjust trade policy to voters’ preferences in developing democracies. My research agenda also includes work on the political economy of sovereign debt, international financial institutions, and intergovernmental transfers.

I am a native of Argentina, where I lectured in political science and international relations and served as a policy analyst in Congress and the City Government of Buenos Aires.
